assessment.claim: Bloom's funding flexibility (allowing rent, salaries, operations) is THE critical differentiator and #1 value-add compared to other accelerators
assessment.reasoning: Multiple founders independently highlighted this as game-changing. Other accelerators restrict funds to materials/equipment purchase, which founders describe as constraining, poor quality, and disempowering.

instances.quote: The thing Bloom has that no one else has: you can use funding for rent or salaries... Other accelerators bring materials for you (bad quality, not what you asked for). I know someone with a fish farm - they gave him $25K in goods worth $10K and told him it's $25K.
If not for this fund I wouldn't be in the shop now... you allowed me to use it for rent and salaries... this simplified everything.

instances.implicit: Bloom is the only one that lets you use funds for operations
instances.note: Not explicitly quoted but implied in comparison discussion

other_accelerators_approach.description: Buy materials for entrepreneurs, restrict to equipment/assets
problems_identified: Sectarian or regional bias in some programs

for_bloom_future.preserve: Funding flexibility MUST remain core feature in any future model
for_bloom_future.amplify: Make this differentiator more visible in marketing/positioning
for_bloom_future.evidence_base: Use founder testimonials about this specific value

for_cooperative_design.principle: Trust entrepreneurs to allocate resources vs. constraining to specific categories
for_cooperative_design.mechanism: Revenue share or profit share gives flexibility, not restricted grants
for_cooperative_design.alignment: High - cooperative model preserves/extends this autonomy

for_ecosystem.insight: Most accelerators are doing it wrong - constraining funds reduces impact
for_ecosystem.opportunity: Bloom could advocate for funding flexibility as best practice

design_principle_extracted.statement: Trust entrepreneurs to allocate funds where they actually need them (rent, salaries, operations) rather than restricting to equipment/materials
design_principle_extracted.rationale: Entrepreneurs know their constraints better than external funders
design_principle_extracted.anti_pattern: Buying materials 'for' entrepreneurs (low quality, no autonomy, inflated costs)

actionable_recommendations.recommendation: Document this differentiator in Bloom case studies
Advocate with Asfari Foundation and other funders for flexible-use grants
Build cooperative model with same flexibility (revenue share vs. restricted funds)
